subject: "Clearscript" alphabet
msgSnippet: I m not sure if anyone is interested, but I ve created a phonetic (phonemic?) alphabet for English in the same vein as the Shavian alphabet and Quikscript. As
messageBody:
I'm not sure if anyone is interested, but I've created a phonetic
(phonemic?) alphabet for English in the same vein as the Shavian
alphabet and Quikscript. As a nod to the latter, I call it
"Clearscript," and it's available at:

www.mrouse.com/rousalph.htm

There's only a tiny bit of material, mainly the alphabet itself and an
IPA chart using the alphabet, plus a brief explanation of some of the
features, but some might find it interesting. Any suggestions or
improvements can be sent to mrouse@.... Thanks!

Mike Rouse

I'm not sure if anyone is interested, but I've created a phonetic
(phonemic?) alphabet for English in the same vein as the Shavian
alphabet and Quikscript. As a nod to the latter, I call it
"Clearscript," and it's available at:

www.mrouse.com/rousalph.htm

There's only a tiny bit of material, mainly the alphabet itself and an
IPA chart using the alphabet, plus a brief explanation of some of the
features, but some might find it interesting. Any suggestions or
improvements can be sent to mrouse@.... Thanks!

Mike Rouse
